verses.verse: Dead <S%H4194><s%> flies <S%H2070><s%> cause the ointment <S%H8081><s%> of the apothecary <S%H7543><s%> to send forth <S%H5042><s%> a stinking savour <S%H887><s%>: so doth a little <S%H4592><s%> folly <S%H5531><s%> him that is in reputation <S%H3368><s%> for wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and honour <S%H3519><s%>. Dead: Heb. Flies of death
A wise man's <S%H2450><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> is at his right hand <S%H3225><s%>; but a fool's <S%H3684><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> at his left <S%H8040><s%>.

Yea also, when he that is a fool <S%H5530><s%> walketh <S%H1980><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%>, his wisdom <S%H3820><s%> faileth <S%H2638><s%> him, and he saith <S%H559><s%> to every one that he is a fool <S%H5530><s%>. his: Heb. his heart

If the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the ruler <S%H4910><s%> rise up <S%H5927><s%> against thee, leave <S%H3240><s%> not thy place <S%H4725><s%>; for yielding <S%H4832><s%> pacifieth <S%H3240><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> offences <S%H2399><s%>.

There is <S%H3426><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, as an error <S%H7684><s%> which proceedeth <S%H3318><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the ruler <S%H7989><s%>: from: Heb. from before
Folly <S%H5529><s%> is set <S%H5414><s%> in great <S%H7227><s%> dignity <S%H4791><s%>, and the rich <S%H6223><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> in low place <S%H8216><s%>. in great: Heb. in great heights
I have seen <S%H7200><s%> servants <S%H5650><s%> upon horses <S%H5483><s%>, and princes <S%H8269><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> as servants <S%H5650><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>.
He that diggeth <S%H2658><s%> a pit <S%H1475><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> into it; and whoso breaketh <S%H6555><s%> an hedge <S%H1447><s%>, a serpent <S%H5175><s%> shall bite <S%H5391><s%> him.
Whoso removeth <S%H5265><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> shall be hurt <S%H6087><s%> therewith; and he that cleaveth <S%H1234><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> shall be endangered <S%H5533><s%> thereby.

If the iron <S%H1270><s%> be blunt <S%H6949><s%>, and he do not whet <S%H7043><s%> the edge <S%H6440><s%>, then must he put <S%H1396><s%> to more strength <S%H2428><s%>: but wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is profitable <S%H3504><s%> to direct <S%H3787><s%>.

Surely the serpent <S%H5175><s%> will bite <S%H5391><s%> without enchantment <S%H3908><s%>; and a babbler <S%H3956><s%> <S%H1167><s%> is no better <S%H3504><s%>. a babbler: Heb. the master of the tongue

The words <S%H1697><s%> of a wise man's <S%H2450><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> are gracious <S%H2580><s%>; but the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> will swallow up <S%H1104><s%> himself. gracious: Heb. grace

The beginning <S%H8462><s%> of the words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> is foolishness <S%H5531><s%>: and the end <S%H319><s%> of his talk <S%H6310><s%> is mischievous <S%H7451><s%> madness <S%H1948><s%>. his talk: Heb. his mouth

A fool <S%H5530><s%> also is full <S%H7235><s%> of words <S%H1697><s%>: a man <S%H120><s%> cannot tell <S%H3045><s%> what shall be; and what shall be after <S%H310><s%> him, who can tell <S%H5046><s%> him? is full: Heb. multiplieth words
The labour <S%H5999><s%> of the foolish <S%H3684><s%> wearieth <S%H3021><s%> every one of them, because he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not how to go <S%H3212><s%> to the city <S%H5892><s%>.
Woe <S%H337><s%> to thee, O land <S%H776><s%>, when thy king <S%H4428><s%> is a child <S%H5288><s%>, and thy princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>!

Blessed <S%H835><s%> art thou, O land <S%H776><s%>, when thy king <S%H4428><s%> is the son <S%H1121><s%> of nobles <S%H2715><s%>, and thy princes <S%H8269><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> in due season <S%H6256><s%>, for strength <S%H1369><s%>, and not for drunkenness <S%H8358><s%>!

By much slothfulness <S%H6103><s%> the building <S%H4746><s%> decayeth <S%H4355><s%>; and through idleness <S%H8220><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> droppeth through <S%H1811><s%>.

A feast <S%H3899><s%> is made <S%H6213><s%> for laughter <S%H7814><s%>, and wine <S%H3196><s%> maketh merry <S%H8055><s%> <S%H2416><s%>: but money <S%H3701><s%> answereth <S%H6030><s%> all things. maketh: Heb. maketh glad the life

Curse <S%H7043><s%> not the king <S%H4428><s%>, no not in thy thought <S%H4093><s%>; and curse <S%H7043><s%> not the rich <S%H6223><s%> in thy bedchamber <S%H2315><s%> <S%H4904><s%>: for a bird <S%H5775><s%> of the air <S%H8064><s%> shall carry <S%H3212><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%>, and that which hath <S%H1167><s%> wings <S%H3671><s%> shall tell <S%H5046><s%> the matter <S%H1697><s%>. thought: or, conscience
